How to Get Strong Recommendation Letters

Why Recommendation Letters Matter

Recommendation letters provide colleges with valuable insights into your character, achievements, and potential. A strong letter from a teacher, counselor, or mentor can significantly enhance your college application.

Tips for Securing Great Letters

  • Choose the Right Recommenders: Select teachers or mentors who know you well and can speak to your strengths, both academically and personally.
  • Ask Early: Give your recommenders at least 4â€“6 weeks to write the letter. This shows respect for their time and allows them to craft a thoughtful response.
  • Provide Relevant Information: Share your resume, transcript, and a list of your accomplishments to help them highlight your achievements.
  • Be Specific About Deadlines: Clearly communicate when the letter is due and provide details about how to submit it (e.g., Common App, email, etc.).
  • Follow Up Politely: Send gentle reminders as the deadline approaches, and thank them for their support.
  • Show Gratitude: Write a thank-you note to your recommenders after they submit their letters.
